result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R. Lowery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Any other counseling, treatment, assessments as recommended by the agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

($355.00 of court costs are from count 3 of this case which are ordered to be paid as a condition of probation in count 2)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel R. Lowery
Current: 2350 S. 23rd Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 02-24-2022)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220

Order to Amend Bail.
The Court hereby orders that based on the stipulation of the parties for the purpose of attending an Alternative to Revocation through Probation and Parole, the defendant's bond is modified from a $2,500.00 cash bond to a $2,500.00 personal recognizance bond.  All other non-monetary conditions of bond shall remain.
Scheduling conference on May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline 04-08-22
Scheduling conference is set for 05-11-22 at 10:00 a.m. Br. 2
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL- 
The State will stipulate to modification of bail to recognizance once the defendant gets confirmation of him entering into an ATR.  
Attorney McCann states that his agent will keep him on a hold until that happens and until a bed is available.
The Court will not amend the bail until the ATR is setup.  The motion is held in abeyance for now.
Parties can file a stipulation and order at that time.  No need for another hearing.
Minutes.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bond

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.    
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 03-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel R. Lowery
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 02-24-2022)
Prior: 2607 S 23Rd St, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony possess THC, possess Methamphetamine and felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-28-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Tasha Harris and Renee VanZon and maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
